meanings.sent1: The new song was popularised by the radio stations.
meanings.sent2: The movie was popularised by word of mouth.
meanings.sent3: The idea of eating ice cream for breakfast was popularised by a mischievous child.
meanings.sent4: Her infectious laughter popularised the mood of the party.
meanings.sent5: The colorful posters popularised the upcoming event in town.

meanings.definition: To bring something to the attention of many people.
meanings.sent1: The social media campaign popularised the charity event.
meanings.sent2: The news article popularised the issue of climate change.
meanings.sent3: The magician popularised his disappearing act by performing it on live television.
meanings.sent4: The bright billboard popularised the new product launch.
meanings.sent5: The viral video popularised the dance move across the internet.
